1.text: And Jonah will pray to Jehovah his God from the bowels of the fish,

2.text: And he will say, I called out of straits to me to Jehovah, and he will answer me; from the belly of hades I cried for help, thou heardest my voice.

3.text: And thou wilt cast me into the depth, into the heart of the seas; and the river will surround me: all thy breakers and thy waves passed over me.

4.text: And I said, I was driven from before thine eyes; yet I shall add to look to thy holy temple.

5.text: The waters encompassed me even to the soul: the deep will surround me, the sedge was bound to my head.

6.text: I shall go down to the cuttings off of the mountains; the earth, her bars about me forever: and thou wilt bring up my life from corruption, O Jehovah my God.

7.text: In my soul fainting upon me I remembered Jehovah: and my prayers will come in to thee to thy holy temple.

8.text: They watching the vanities of falsehood will forsake their kindness.

9.text: And I will sacrifice to thee with the voice of praise; what I vowed I will requite. Salvation is to Jehovah.

10.text: And Jehovah will say to the fish, and he will vomit forth Jonah upon the dry land.
